title: 115_hr3715
content: The Act titled "Scenic Columbia Gorge Restoration Act of 2017" allows for expedited recovery activities in response to catastrophic events in national scenic areas. The Act defines "catastrophic event" as any natural disaster or fire, flood, or explosion, and "conclusion" as including containment of the event. It also defines "National Scenic Area" as an area with outstanding natural, scenic, and recreational values. Within 30 days after a catastrophic event in a National Scenic Area, the Secretary must propose response activities for the affected lands. The term "National Scenic Area" refers to an area recognized for its natural, scenic, and recreational values. The Secretary, defined as the Secretary of Agriculture acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, is responsible for this process. The Secretary of Agriculture, through the Chief of the Forest Service, must propose response activities within 30 days of a catastrophic event in a National Scenic Area. Public input and a response process are required, including a 30-day public scoping and comment period, a 15-day objection filing period, and a 15-day agency response period. After completion of the process, the Secretary will implement the response activity. An expedited environmental assessment is also required. The Secretary must propose response activities within 30 days of a catastrophic event in a National Scenic Area. An expedited environmental assessment for a response activity must be completed within 60 days after the event. A categorical exclusion is available for response activities not exceeding 10,000 acres within the area. A categorical exclusion is available for National Scenic Area response activities that do not exceed 10,000 acres and include lands visible from key viewing areas, provide screening for development, are part of a municipal watershed, or contain utility right-of-ways. No consultation is needed under the Endangered Species Act if the response activity is not likely to harm listed species. Consultation under the Endangered Species Act is not required if a response activity is not likely to harm listed species or critical habitat. Expedited consultation must be concluded within 90 days for activities that do not fall under the exemption. Consultation under the Endangered Species Act must be concluded within 90 days of the request. If not concluded within this timeframe, the activity may proceed without violating the Act. No restraining orders or injunctions are allowed during this process. The Knutson-Vandenberg Act special fund will provide funding for response activities on National Scenic Area lands impacted by catastrophic events, with a focus on achieving reforestation goals. No court orders or injunctions can be issued to halt response activities, and challenges to these activities are exempt from Section 705 of title 5, United States Code. The Secretary is responsible for response activities, including achieving reforestation of 75% of National Scenic Area lands impacted by catastrophic events within two years.
